title.narrative: Financial support for the position of General Secretary and Finance officer.

description.narrative: The South Sudan Council of Churches (SSCC) is in the continuous process of the implementation of the Action Plan for Peace (APP) through delivery of four programme outcomes relating to Advocacy, Neutral Forum, Reconciliation and Institutional capacity strengthening. Through this church-led, nation-wide and multi-stakeholder engagement actions, SCCC envisage the realisation of a peaceful resolution of conflict and restoration of peace in South Sudan. The first phase of the action plan for peace 2016-2017 has ended and SSCC is now implementing a new phase 2018-2021 through annual funding from all its partners including CTP. Given the peace agreement signed, the SSCC would like to scale up its operation in Bahr El Ghazal, Equatoria and Greater Upper Nile Regions. The council under capacity strengthening outcomes would like to request CTP to support the General Secretary and Finance officer (Accountant) in the secretariat. The position of the General Secretary existed before when the Action Plan for peace (APP) was launched and it manages all the functions in the SSCC Secretariat. This position is covered by the EU grant at only 30% leaving all the percentage for the support of SSCC secretariat whose financial support tremendously reduced due to reduction in its retained income. SSCC has also already recruited a Finance officer (Accountant) who is based at the head office. The finance officer is responsible for managing all financial records of the regions including partners and donor funds for implementation of activities in the regions and also gives support to the finance department at the head office.
